description: Experts who utilize analytical, statistical, and programming skills to collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to derive actionable insights for business decision-making.
Engineers focusing on designing, building, and deploying self-running software that can automate predictive models and leverage artificial intelligence.
Professionals responsible for finding trends in datasets and developing algorithms to help make raw data more useful to the enterprise.
Analysts who interpret data and turn it into information which can offer ways to improve a business, thus affecting business decisions.
Specialists who analyze complex data sets to identify business and market trends, helping companies make smart financial and operational decisions.
Researchers who investigate new approaches to artificial intelligence and machine learning, typically focusing on advancing the state-of-the-art.
Engineers specialized in the interaction between computers and human language, working on tasks like translation, sentiment analysis, and chatbots.
Professionals who develop algorithms and systems that enable computers to interpret and make decisions based on visual data from the world.
Architects who plan, design, and manage large-scale data processing systems and data governance strategies for an organization.
Specialists responsible for the performance, integrity, and security of a database, ensuring data remains consistent across the database.
Engineers who combine Machine Learning, DevOps, and Data Engineering to deploy, maintain, and monitor ML models in production efficiently.
Professionals who use mathematical and statistical methods to solve financial and risk management problems.
Experts who collect, analyze, and interpret data to identify trends and relationships which are used to inform decision-making in various fields.
Specialists who ensure that artificial intelligence systems are developed and used in a responsible, fair, and transparent manner.
Analysts who focus on analyzing marketing metrics to improve campaign performance, customer acquisition, and ROI.
Specialists who design and refine inputs (prompts) for Large Language Models to generate optimal outputs for various applications.
A specialized subset of ML engineers who focus specifically on deep neural networks and complex algorithms inspired by the human brain.
Engineers who design, build, and maintain robots and robotic systems, often integrating hardware with software and AI.
Analysts who interpret complex healthcare data to improve patient outcomes, operational efficiency, and reduce costs within medical organizations.
Professionals who examine financial data to identify trends, forecast future financial scenarios, and assist in investment decisions.
Developers who specialize in building the user interface and user experience of websites and web applications using client-side technologies.
Engineers who build and maintain the mechanisms that process data and perform actions on websites, focusing on databases, scripting, and architecture.
Versatile developers comfortable working with both back-end and front-end technologies, capable of building complete web applications.
Professionals who bridge the gap between software development and IT operations to shorten the systems development life cycle.
Security experts who plan and carry out security measures to protect an organization's computer networks and systems.
Senior professionals responsible for overseeing a company's cloud computing strategy, including cloud adoption plans, application design, and management.
Software developers who specialize in designing and building applications for the Android operating system.
Developers specialized in building applications for Apple devices, including iPhones, iPads, and Apple Watches.
High-level experts who make high-level design choices and dictate technical standards, including software coding standards, tools, and platforms.
Engineers who design and write computer programs to run tests on software automatically, ensuring quality and stability.
Ethical hackers who simulate cyberattacks on computer systems, networks, and applications to identify security vulnerabilities.
Engineers who treat operations as if it’s a software problem, ensuring large-scale systems are reliable, scalable, and efficient.
Designers who focus on the visual layout (UI) and the user's journey and experience (UX) within a digital product.
Software developers who specialize in creating video games for consoles, computers, and mobile devices.
Developers who specialize in developing decentralized applications (dApps) and smart contracts based on blockchain architecture.
IT professionals who design, implement, and manage the local and wide area networks of an organization to ensure connectivity.
Professionals responsible for the upkeep, configuration, and reliable operation of computer systems and servers.
Engineers who design and implement software that runs on embedded devices, often with real-time constraints and hardware limitations.
Product managers with a strong technical background who work with engineering teams to guide product development and strategy.
Specialized developers who build applications and customize the Salesforce Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platform.
Experts in SAP software who help organizations implement, customize, and maintain their SAP ERP systems.
Senior roles responsible for protecting an organization's computers, networks, and data against computer viruses, security breaches, and malicious hacker attacks.
Professionals who plan, organize, and integrate cross-functional information technology projects that are significant in scope and impact.
Communicators who translate complex technical information into easily understandable documentation, manuals, and guides.
Engineers who integrate security practices within the DevOps process, ensuring security is a shared responsibility throughout the IT lifecycle.
Developers who design and implement software robots (bots) to automate repetitive, rule-based business processes.
Specialists who create immersive experiences for Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR) headsets and mobile devices.
Architects who design the end-to-end strategy for Internet of Things (IoT) systems, connecting sensors, networks, and cloud platforms.
Developers who configure and customize the ServiceNow platform to manage enterprise IT workflows and business processes.
Scientists who apply data science and computational techniques to biological data, such as genetic sequences and protein structures.
Analysts who manage, analyze, and display geographic data using Geographic Information Systems (GIS) software.
Cybersecurity professionals who gather and analyze digital evidence from computers and networks for legal purposes.
Professionals who evaluate an organization's IT infrastructure, policies, and operations to ensure they comply with regulations and standards.
Managers responsible for planning, scheduling, and controlling the software build through different stages and environments.
Engineers specializing in Voice over IP systems, ensuring high-quality voice and video communication over networks.
Engineers who handle the technical aspects of adapting software, websites, and games for different languages and regions.
Specialists who ensure data availability, usability, integrity, and security across an enterprise, establishing data standards.
Architects who design and implement complex blockchain-based solutions for enterprise use cases, selecting appropriate platforms.
Technical experts who work alongside sales teams to demonstrate software capabilities and design solutions for prospective clients.
Engineers who design, develop, and test computer hardware components such as circuit boards, processors, and routers.
Specialists focusing on the planning, design, implementation, and optimization of wireless local area networks (WLANs).
Developers who maintain and write code for mainframe systems, which are used by large organizations for critical bulk data processing.
Tech-savvy professionals who manage the technical and operational aspects of online sales platforms to maximize revenue.
Experts who ensure websites and applications are usable by people with disabilities, complying with legal standards like WCAG.
IT professionals who design, implement, and maintain data storage solutions, including SAN, NAS, and cloud storage.
Researchers exploring the frontiers of quantum mechanics to develop new types of computers that can solve problems classical computers cannot.
Experts who design and oversee the implementation of Customer Relationship Management systems to support business sales and support goals.
Analysts who study an organization's current computer systems and procedures and design information systems solutions to help the organization operate more efficiently.
Engineers who build and maintain the self-service internal developer platforms (IDPs) that software teams use to deploy and manage their applications.
Marketing technologists who manage paid search campaigns to increase visibility and drive traffic to websites.
Security specialists who manage digital identities and user access privileges to ensure the right people have access to the right resources.
Engineers who stress-test software applications to ensure they perform well under expected and peak load conditions.
Professionals who act as a bridge between a company's engineering team and its developer community, creating tutorials, docs, and demos.
Experts who optimize websites to rank higher in organic search engine results, driving unpaid traffic.
Cybersecurity professionals who are the first line of defense during a security breach, analyzing and mitigating attacks in real-time.
Executive role responsible for the overall technological direction and strategy of an organization.
Professionals who provide technical assistance and support for incoming queries and issues related to computer systems, software, and hardware.
Engineers who develop the software used to generate images, such as rendering engines for games, movies, or scientific visualization.
Security experts who review blockchain smart contract code to identify bugs, vulnerabilities, and security risks before deployment.
Architects who design and build business applications using low-code/no-code platforms, minimizing the need for traditional programming.
Engineers who test and validate hardware or software systems (often in manufacturing/semiconductors) to ensure they meet design specifications.
Specialized IT administrators in healthcare who manage Picture Archiving and Communication Systems used for medical imaging (X-rays, MRIs).
Investigators who recover and investigate material found in digital devices, often in relation to computer crime.
Programmers who develop software for audio processing, music production, game audio, or voice recognition systems.
Data analysts specialized in Human Resources Information Systems, bridging the gap between HR processes and IT.
Software developers who build applications that use geographic data, maps, and location services.
Recruiters who specialize in sourcing and hiring candidates for technical roles like software engineering and data science.
Hardware engineers who design and program Field-Programmable Gate Arrays for specialized computing tasks.
Data-driven marketers who improve the percentage of website visitors who complete a desired action (like buying a product).
Managers responsible for sourcing and purchasing technology equipment, software, and services for an organization.
Technical specialists who manage tracking codes (tags) on websites to ensure accurate data collection for analytics and marketing.
C-level executive responsible for enterprise-wide governance and utilization of information as an asset, via data processing and mining.
Analysts who monitor bank accounts and financial transactions to identify and prevent fraudulent activity using data and software.
Developers specialized in coding responsive HTML emails and managing technical aspects of email marketing platforms.
Creatives who use software to create animated graphics and visual effects for web, video, and user interfaces.
Technicians who install, maintain, and repair telecommunications equipment and lines for internet and phone services.
Professionals who manage the collective knowledge of an organization, ensuring information is stored, organized, and accessible.
Designers who focus specifically on how users interact with a product, defining the behavior of interface elements.
Sales professionals specialized in selling software products (SaaS) to other businesses.
Professionals who sit at the intersection of clinical care and IT, helping design systems that work well for doctors and nurses.
